title: Will Campbell talks poor Super Bowl performance, avoiding media, and more
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell apologized for avoiding media after allowing 14 pressures in the Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss to Seattle.
Coach Mike Vrabel confirmed Campbell will remain the Patriots' left tackle despite his struggles and missed games due to injury.
Campbell, a 22-year-old rookie, acknowledged his poor Super Bowl performance but remains optimistic about improving in future seasons.

title: Mike Vrabel on the Patriots’ foundation, his view of the 2025 season, and Will Campbell’s future
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel reflects on Patriots' 2025 season, noting their improvement and foundation despite Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Offensive tackle Will Campbell, criticized for Super Bowl performance, will remain at his position, head coach Mike Vrabel confirms.
Defensive coordinator Terrell Williams to return in 2026 after battling cancer, creating staffing decisions for coach Mike Vrabel.

title: Boston to host FIFA World Cup Fan Fest at City Hall Plaza
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston will host the FIFA World Cup Fan Festival at City Hall Plaza, announced by Mayor Michelle Wu.
The festival will feature live entertainment, local food, and interactive experiences for fans not attending matches in Foxborough.
The World Cup events in Massachusetts are expected to generate $100 million in tax revenue and create over 9,000 jobs.

title: Are MBTA commuters destined to suffer for the rest of the winter?
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: MBTA commuters face delays and cancellations due to frigid winter temperatures and snow drifts, with more snow expected.
MBTA General Manager Phil Eng promises improvements and urges patience as older Red Line cars remain essential to meet demand.
MBTA plans to use crib heaters and store vehicles indoors to address winter-related operational issues across its services.

title: Wu says she would vote for statewide rent control through proposed ballot question
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu supports a statewide rent control ballot question, though she prefers local options for rent policies.
The proposed measure ties rent hikes to cost of living with a 5% cap and exempts certain buildings.
Governor Maura Healey opposes the measure, citing potential impacts on housing construction and affordability.

title: Christian Gonzalez on Patriots extension talks: ‘I don’t want to be anywhere else’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez is considering a contract extension with the New England Patriots this offseason.
Gonzalez expressed his desire to remain with the Patriots, saying he doesn't want to be anywhere else.
Gonzalez had standout performances in the postseason, significantly helping New England's Super Bowl run.

title: Man dies after being struck by MBTA commuter rail train in Haverhill
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A man died after intentionally entering the tracks and being struck by an MBTA train in Haverhill at 6:11 a.m.
The incident prompted an investigation by MBTA Transit Police and Essex County District Attorney's Office.
Haverhill Line trains experienced delays, with service resuming around 8:30 a.m. after police activity on the right of way.

title: Boston Raising Cane’s faces eviction over chicken finger odor, lawsuit says
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Raising Cane's in Boston files lawsuit against landlord 755 Boylston, LLC, claiming eviction threat over chicken finger odor.
The chain alleges landlord's odor complaints aim to breach lease clause granting exclusive chicken restaurant rights.
Raising Cane's spent $200,000 on odor mitigation, claims building issues contribute to problem as landlord seeks new tenants.

title: Revolution reveal ‘Independence Day’ jersey
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution unveiled a special 'Independence Day' jersey for the nation's 250th birthday with a fireworks-themed design.
The 'Independence Day' jersey will be worn in the 2026 and 2027 MLS seasons, paired with navy shorts and red, white, and blue socks.
Fans can purchase the new jersey at pop-up events in Boston's Old State House and Ducali Pizzeria & Bar on Tuesday.

title: About a dozen vehicles damaged by a bridge joint on I-91 in Western Mass.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: About a dozen vehicles were damaged by a raised bridge joint on I-91 in Western Massachusetts.
MassDOT and State Police responded promptly, cutting the protruding joint and aiding disabled vehicles.
Massachusetts law allows claims for personal injury from roadway defects, capped at $4,000, but not for property damage.
